info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 4 at 1:50PM PDT until September 4 at 3:49PM PDT by NWS San Diego CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, Riverside.
* WHEN...Until 349 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 150 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southeastern Palm Springs, Anza, Hwy 74 Between Anza And Palm Desert, Hwy 74 Between Mountain Center And Anza, Lake Hemet, Cahuilla Indian Reservation and Santa Rosa Mountain. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 349 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON
